body:
> Did you have `zrender` installed at the same directory with `incubator-echarts`?

Thanks. I'm not sure what do you mean by "the same directory".

I followed the instruction in this file, https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md. It indicates that we should install the zrender outside the echarts directory. Specifically, by following the instruction below can lead to this error. 
```
cd ~/workspace/echarts
npm install
cd ~/workspace/zrender
npm install
--> the same error
```
Also, the error also occurs by running:
```
cd ~/workspace/zrender
npm install
cd ~/workspace/echarts
npm install
--> the same error
```
However, Running "npm install zrender" first **in the directory** "~/workspace/echarts" can fix the error.
```
cd ~/workspace/echarts
npm install zrender
npm install
--> no error
```
Maybe updating the CONTRIBUTING.md file would help.

> Have you tried with cloning echarts and zrender without forking, that is, `git clone git@github.com:apache/incubator-echarts.git`?

Just tried. Cloned zrender locally by `git clone git@github.com:ecomfe/zrender.git` in "~/workspace/zrender", and cloned echarts locally by `git clone git@github.com:apache/incubator-echarts.git` in "\~/workspace/echarts".

The same error occurred.
Update package-lock.json?

> Update package-lock.json?

I cloned the latest incubator-echarts, the package-lock.json should be updated. I also compared my local file with the git one, and they're the same.
what I am saying is: package-lock.json in the repo may have been updated.

> what I am saying is: package-lock.json in the repo may have been updated.

Do you mean this file? https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/package-lock.json
If so, yes, I am using the latest one.

Not quite sure what's the problem here. Wait for someone else to help.

> Not quite sure what's the problem here. Wait for someone else to help.

Sorry if this is confusing. I just start to look at this project. What I'm trying to say is:
By following the instruction in https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md, the error (described at the beginning) is shown when running (Step 2):
```
cd ~/workspace/echarts
npm install
```
Since zrender is one of the dependencies, why it couldn't be installed after running "npm install"?
echarts core team have left it out on purpose, because they do it manually. For development purpose, they would like to install latest and development version zrender.

> echarts core team have left it out on purpose, because they do it manually. For development purpose, they would like to install latest and development version zrender.

This makes sense, thanks for the clarification!

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

Sorry, but please ask *how-to* questions on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/echarts) or [segmentfaultï¼ˆä¸­æ–‡ï¼‰](https://segmentfault.com/t/echarts). 

Here's why:

Maintaining open source projects, especially popular ones, is [hard work](https://nolanlawson.com/2017/03/05/what-it-feels-like-to-be-an-open-source-maintainer/). As ECharts's user base has grown, we are getting more and more usage questions, bug reports, feature requests and pull requests every single day.

As a free and open source project, ECharts also has limited maintainer bandwidth. That means the only way to ensure the project's sustainability is to:

1. Prioritize more concrete work (bug fixes and new features);
2. Improve issue triaging efficiency.

For (1), we have decided to use the GitHub issue lists exclusively for work that has well-defined, actionable goals. Questions and open ended discussions should be posted to mediums that are better suited for them.

For (2), we have found that issues that do not provide proper information upfront usually results in terribly inefficient back-and-forth communication just to extract the basic information needed for actual triaging. This is exactly why we have created this app: to ensure that every issue is created with the necessary information, and to save time on both sides.
